message:
Restrict public access to S3 buckets (AWS Security Best Practices): Ensure that S3 buckets do not allow public access. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/access-control-block-public-access.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/access-control-block-public-access.html)

Implement bucket versioning for easy recovery (AWS Security Best Practices): Enable S3 bucket versioning to protect against accidental deletion or modification of objects. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/Versioning.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/Versioning.html)

Enable server-side encryption for all objects stored in S3 (AWS Security Best Practices): Use server-side encryption (SSE) to protect data at rest in S3. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/serv-side-encryption.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/serv-side-encryption.html)

Encrypt data in transit using SSL/TLS (AWS Security Best Practices): Enable SSL/TLS encryption (HTTPS) for data transfers between clients and S3. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingHTTPHTTPS.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingHTTPHTTPS.html)

Enable AWS CloudTrail logging for S3 (AWS Security Best Practices): Enable AWS CloudTrail to log S3 API activities for monitoring and audit purposes. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awscloudtrail/latest/userguide/cloudtrail-s3-bucket-settings.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awscloudtrail/latest/userguide/cloudtrail-s3-bucket-settings.html)

Enable S3 Bucket-level logging (AWS Security Best Practices): Enable S3 bucket-level logging to capture detailed access logs for tracking and analysis. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ServerLogs.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ServerLogs.html)

Enable S3 block public access (CIS AWS Foundations): Enable S3 block public access to prevent public access to S3 buckets and objects. URL: [https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/CIS_Amazon_Web_Services_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf](https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/CIS_Amazon_Web_Services_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf)

Enable S3 object lock (CIS AWS Foundations): Enable S3 object lock to prevent object deletion or modification for a specified retention period. URL: [https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/CIS_Amazon_Web_Services_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf](https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/CIS_Amazon_Web_Services_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf)

Enable S3 default encryption (CIS AWS Foundations): Enable default encryption on S3 buckets to ensure that all objects are encrypted. URL: [https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/CIS_Amazon_Web_Services_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf](https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/CIS_Amazon_Web_Services_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf)

Enable access logging for S3 buckets (CIS AWS Foundations): Enable access logging for S3 buckets to capture detailed access logs for tracking and analysis. URL: [https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/CIS_Amazon_Web_Services_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf](https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/CIS_Amazon_Web_Services_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf)

List security controls for Amazon S3 based on guidelines from CIS, NIST, AWS Security Best Practices, and STIGs. Use direct imperative commands, focusing on access management, encryption, monitoring, and network controls. For each control, include the specific source and a URL for direct access to additional details. Omit introductions, conclusions, comments, and warnings about content limitations.

Examples:

Implement the principle of least privilege for IAM permissions (AWS Security Best Practices): Ensure IAM policies for S3 are restricted to necessary operations. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/best-practices.html

Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for object deletion (CIS AWS Foundations): Require multi-factor authentication to delete objects. URL: https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf

Enable server-side encryption for all objects stored in S3 (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Use AWS S3 SSE to protect data at rest. URL: https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf

Use policies to enforce encryption on upload (AWS Security Best Practices): Configure bucket policies to reject unencrypted object uploads. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/using-iam-policies.html
